text: From tap at Russian River, Santa Rosa. Aroma is vinous with red wine, grapes, sour red and dark fruits, tart berries, vinegar, caramel, wood, and light funk. Flavour is nicely puckering sour. Body is above medium, rich.. Complex with a stunning tart dark fruity aroma, ample grapes and berries, a great wine sour!

Bottle at Federal Taphouse Harrisburg. Pours brown with a thin khaki head. Huge red wine, wood, and tartness on the nose. Lots of red wine, dark fruit, and wood on the tongue. Hides its booze well. Nice!

Brought back from the brewery in Santa Rosa by my son - thanks! Hazy, light copper pour, not much of a head to speak of. Pleasant sour aroma, some Sweet Tarts candy. some apricot sourness. First impression of the flavor is that of walking into a humidor with some solid cedar woody accents, a touch of apricot, some raspberry sourness. Solid spritz to the mouthfeel. solid brew!

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Overhyped like action movie sequels. Pours brown with decent head. Sharp oak and some red wine. A lot of sour citrus. Very acidic and not much depth here. Perhaps a bad batch, or it went bad? Really getting nothing like what other raters said. Bottled March 2015.

29-04-17 // bottle shared at Le Petit Belge, Wiesbaden. Thanks for sharing Zwiebel88! (Batch 110614). Murky brown red beer, white lacing. Nose is already very complex, redwine, sherry, leather. Taste is highly complex aswell, light sourness, light wood, red wine, sherry, marsala,dark fruits, cranberry, black currants, sour cherry, light tobacco spicey.

375ml bottle at home. Hazy muddy ruby-brown with a thin tan head that dissipates quickly. Notes of red grapes, Cabernet Sauvignon wine (coincidentally, my favourite wine), mould, dank cellar, brettanomyces, dark berries, bitter cherries, some raspberry, a subtle dark malt roastiness, or more like chocolate bitterness. Overall, more bitter and less sour than I was expecting from the style, which makes it resemble a wine quite a bit. Complex and layered.

Aromas of black cherries, toffee, barrel wood, tart fruits, plums, apricots, dark malts, black currants, aged malts, carbonated fig juice, funky brett, barnyard and yeast funk. Pours a deep crimson brown with no foam whatsoever. Taste brings tart cherries, apricots, toffee, brown sugar, sweet dark wort malt, plums, prune juice and sour apple. Mid palate brings wine barrel, merlot, grape must, yeast esters, candied sugars, sugared grape juice and a nutty malt base. Finishes tart and moderately sour with more red wine, oak, grape must, brett yeast and barnyard funk. Overall, an absolute gem. The beer that got me into sours. A+ rating.

Bottle & tap at RR. Pours murky red brown, off white head. Aroma is tart dark fruits, berries, grape, oak, barnyard, prune. Flavor is tart cherries, grape, earthy funk, raisin, currants. Farly tart, wine like & complex.

Slightly hazy red-amber with a small beige head. The aroma has some vanilla, acid, funk, cherry and caramelized sugar. The flavor is similar, with some medium sourness and a dry, vanilla and oak finish. Doesnt come off as a strong beer at all. Very good!

A 375ml corked and caged bottle, bottled on 4th April 2016, poured into a Cantillon ballon glass. It was a dark reddish brown colour with a two finger light tan head that dissipated quickly while leaving only slight lacing. Aromas of lots of oak, cherry, blackcurrant, grape and red wine. Tastes of sweet-ish blackcurrant and cherries followed by sourness, oak, red wine, vinegar and light funk. Light to medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall this was just like drinking red wine with carbonation. There was no sign of the 10% ABV, and although I thought the aroma was better than the taste, both were still good.

Bottle, by way of a trade. Bottling date January 2016. Clear, deep ruby red. Slimmest ring of off white head. Nose has sweet vine fruit. Vanilla oak. Red wine cork. Touch of mouldy funk. Some sweet morello cherry. Smells pretty amazing. Taste is dry and lightly acidic. Bit of a balsamic sweetness. Tart and dry mouthfeel. Some cleansing tartness. Mouldy cherry sweetness, and balsamic acidity to finish. Wow. Great beer.
bottle. Clear brown color with a very small head. Aroma has ripe dark grapes, very vineous, slight hint of blackcurrants. Very dry, high on acidity. Very sour finish. Sublime

375ml bottle. Ambers cherry color with an off white head. Sweet grape wine aroma. Cherry tart wood sweet sour flavor. Medium carbonated body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap at the brewery. Clear copper reddish brown color with off white to beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma, dusty, dark dried fruits, tart fruity, grass notesm wood, vinous. Sweet, acidic and light bitter taste. Almost medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle from a friend. Fruity and tart with dark berries, like cherries and wood, earth cellar. Similar taste. Nice!

On tap at Pizza Port, OB. Fruity, slightly oaky, and sour brown sugar aroma. Almost clear orangish brown under a tan collar. Complex, vinous flavour with sour cherries, white grapes, brown sugar, and oak. No bitterness. Medium light body, moderate carbonation, sour, but not puckering, clean.
Red brown pour. Some foam. Aroma tangy sour cherries some vinegar. Tastes red licorice, sour cabernet. Very dry but restrained with a razorlike edge or sour. Excellent.

Bottle in Encinitas. This is a special beer, happy to finally ratebit after many tastes. This is not nearly as sweet as Supplication but is more complex. The currants, oak and malts really give this a deep, dark flavor that other red/brown sours dont often approach. Very limited vinegar and acidity taste, the tartness is more dark fruit instead. Fantastic beer.
Amazing Sour Ale, One of the Best high gravity Sours out there. dark fruits, nice tartness. a sipper!
Pours hazy brown with almost no head. Aromas of cherries, almonds, ripe red apples. Taste is sour and very fruity with some herbal notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Poured into a tulip, the appearance was a dark amber color with a quickly dissipating thin fizzy white head. No lacing.
The aroma starts off with a thin white grape/vinous overlay to some dark fruits, currants. Sly amount of dark chocolate.
The flavor yields to the tartness first. And then sharpens against a nice vinous quality coming from a dry woody edge. Dark chocolate seems a bit more scaled back. Quick vinous sweet to dry dark fruity aftertaste. No finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with an appropriate carbonation to it, medium strength without letting acidity to get too tough on the feel.
Overall, nicely done American Wild ale using wine barrel to be the sour. Thanks Paul.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Tap@ deep copper brown, opaque, with off-white long lasting foamy head. Aroma: black currant, toasted toffee, bitter dark chocolate, , vineyard, different grapes...flavor is intense, complex, with toasted toffee, dark chocolate like malt backbone, supported with fruity notes of grapes, citrusy, fruity notes of hops, black currant, some vine, vanillin, hint of tobacco...finish is dry, astringent sourish. Body is full, texture soft, carbonation is medium.

TAP. Pours an amber/ruby with zero head.. The nose is sweet, dark berries & the barrel.. Malt base, yet gives way to dark berries & the cab barrel, wine notes come in yet finish with a solid zesty bite.. Sourced Russian river brewing

375ml 04.04.2016 bottle, thanks JC. Aroma: extremely winey, sweet black currant, cherries and other berries. App: red with brownish tint, no head. Really similar to an aged wine. Taste and palate: light to medium body, medium sweetness, vinous a lot, fruity, moderate acidity finish. Overall: this one could benefit more aging without a doubt to cut on the sweetness a bit. Too sweet in its current state making its drinkability moderate. On the positive side, nice black currant presence. Good.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a white head. Aroma of dark fruits, tobacco, red grapes, slight vinegary - tho undertoned by the wood, fruity. Taste is rather sour with loads of sweet dried fruits, black currents, quite alot of tannis, slight touch of vinegar.
Så er der solbærjuice! Brun og lidt kedelig at se på, men det gemmer sig et væld af behageligheder! Surt, men velbalanceret af sultanas og andet tørret frugt som findes i små æsker!
Sample at the brewery. nice brown sour ale in contraposition to light belgian style.

2014 btl, pours a clear light ruby color, small dense off white head that vanished quickly, leaving a ring of bubbles around the glass. No lace on glass. Aromas of berries,wood, dirt,barnyard, musty wine cellar, and a hint of alcohol. Tastes of sour zots candy,dark berries, fresh baked berry pie, dark wine and a hint of alcohol. Medium body, a little under carbonated, maybe due to age, bold, sour mouthfeel and a soft yet astringent, puckering finish. Wow! This beer is amazing. So many flavors going on, my description does not do it justice. This has got to be one of the best sours Ive ever had the pleasure of drinking. Absolutely, positively, fantastic! Merry Christmas everyone.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Draft at the source. Amber color with an off-white head. Aroma is vinous, dark fruits and berries. Taste is vinous, dark fruits, currants, Cabernet, oak, vinegar. Quite sour. Acetic, tart finish. Very good.
375ml bottle. Mahogany with a thin ring of white foam. Flavors are oak, brown sugar and balsamic vinegar with fruity and vinous notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, slick texture.

Aroma: sweet with cab and currant undertones; Appearance: dark amber with thin white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: nicely sour and fruity; good balance; Palate: medium body with long, sour finish; Overall: intensely delicious. Would get again.

Currants, a light funk, some spice and a bit of alcohol on the nose. The taste is dark fruits with a pretty high sourness and a nice wine-like character. A nice carbonation with some oak coming through as the beer warms. One of my favorite sours!
Bottle. This is a really well done sour ale. There is so much going on here that you get a different angle every sip.

Thank you to Brad for sharing this with me. Pours a copper in color with a quickly fading beige head. The aroma gives off spices, grape, wine, oak, apple, and alcohol, without any of these impressions standing out over others. The taste makes you think of wine. It has grape, spices, alcohol, and vinegar and some earthiness. Its quite tart, with mild sourness. This is medium in body, with a sticky texture, and has some soft, bubbly carbonation. Altogether, this one is different, with many impressions of wine as advertised.
Imperialny Flanders ze znakomicie ukrytym alkoholem i wyraźnymi jeżynami. Wyraźny, acz delikatny ocet winny, bardzo dużo nut czerwonego, wytrawnego wina. Podobny do Oblivion z Wicked Weed.
Bottle shared at Chmielarnia. Nice fruity and wine aroma, hint of earth and barrel. Taste is light to medium sour, dry, hint of vinegar, berries, wood, wine. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel RR Rami Rami is drinking a Consecration by Russian River Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaCzad. Ciut octu, falnders, wanilia, w smaku wiecej owocow, wina, drewna... Sa tez taniny, kwaskowatosc bardzo pod kontrola... CzadOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Pours mahogany into a tumbler. Off-white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Cinnamon, cherry and clove aromas. Tart with dark cherry upfront turning to pith, sour earth and cabernet before the jaw clenching, medium length finish.

Shared 12.68 oz. bottle poured to a snifter showing a lightly hazed, amber highlighted, brown tone, with a modest layer of tan foam, and spots of lacing. The nose was vinous, dark grape & currant. Ditto on the taste, tart & tangy, with a hint of woodiness as cedar. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, and complementary, tannic bitterness. A treat for us Midwesterners!
Aroma carries the barrels well. Tart sour and wine. Red brown with hazy appearance. Taste is lighter than I thought. Mouth is claggy. Tap
Draught beer at the taproom. Very impressive. I like this beer a lot. Definitely have it back.
I dont have a detailed comments, Im a beginner, but I really like this beer
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 375ml bottle at home, batch 010816. Balsamic and wine nose. Flavor, interesting balance of sour and dry with a wine influence. sugar sweetness is almost gone.

375ml bottle at Brians (thx, Brian!). Bottled 08-Jan-2016. Pours a slightly hazy copper with no head. Sour aroma is more intense than Supplication one, brings out some sweetness, tart wine barrels, cherry notes, some balsamic and even alcohol notes. Taste is pretty the same character, quite dry. Amazing beer, but I would prefer it to have more sweetness as for an Imperial version with 10 ABV.
Bottle. Pours an amber brown. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, vinegar, and red wine.

very very very good. I'd certainly be willing to drink this beer again and again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

B. 071813 - Cola-candy, forest fruits, vanilla and cherry dominates the aroma. The flavor reminds me of red wine, quite sour, but balanced. Slight allspice, nuts, blackcurrants. A very complex and long lasting finish.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 001x3 bottle thanks to Bill. Pours clear amber brown  with no head. Raisin, black currant, Cabernet red wine, smells like Holliday fruit cake. Slight caramel note. A bit of oxidation. Light mouthfeel.

Rating #1000! 37.5cl bottle. Lots of white wine aroma over wooden barrel. Smooth sourness with currant flavours and some iron, but not rusty at all. Tart. Medium to light carbonation. Short intense finish, very dry. Vinous throughout, getting more intense as its warming up. Very, very pleasant.
Batch 008. Bottle shared by Karl Meyer thanks. No head and clear burbun color. Complex aroma with lactic acidity dried sea weed ,wood aged. Well fermented to give a perfect acidity and no sweetness.
Overall very drinkable and not overwhelmingly sour. Leads off with a burst of fruit followed by the light aftertaste of cab sauv.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, California (20.04.2016)  

Sour Dark Ale leżakowane w dębowych beczkach po Cabernet Sauvignon z lokalnej winiarni. Leżakowało od 4 do 8 miesięcy w beczkach z dodatkiem czarnych porzeczek, dzikich drożdży Brettanomyces, bakterii kwasu mlekowego Lactobacilllus i Pediococcus do każdej z beczek.

10% alk. 19,5 BLG  

Aromat POTĘŻNY, głęboki, WIELOWYMIAROWY. Mam wrażenie, że nigdy się nie kończy. Zapach jest dziki, winny, trochę stajenny, końska derka, stajnia, siano, skóra. OGROMNA wanilia, nuty beczki, mokrego drewna, dębiny. Bardzo wyraznie ukierunkowanie w strone ciemnych winogron i czerwonego wina. W smaku chwilami przypomina Duchesse de Bourgogne. Tak wiele się tutaj dzieje. Po kilku łykach dochodzą do tego nuty czarnej porzeczki, ponownie brettów, wiśni. W aftertaste wyczuwalne trufle.
Bardzo gęsty trunek. Wybitnie degustacyjny. GENIALNE! WYBITNE! Jedyne w swoim rodzaju piwo! Jedno z najlepszych jakie piłem w moim życiu 5.0 bez dwóch zdań!

Pours slight hazy brown/amber with minimal head even thought it has some great carbonation. AROMA: red wine acidity, berries, caramel, currants, apples, slight spices, woody, earthy, tart, mellow citrus, phenolic and malty. TASTE: malty, currants tart berries, bitter sharp apples/pears, red wine tannins, herbal, light spices, faint bitter chocolate, earthy and boozy. AFTER TASTE: tannins, malty, currants, spices and earthy with a dry vinous finish.
Pours a dark murky reddish brown color. Aromas of dark fruit, yeast, vinegar, and a touch of wood. Flavor is sour, yeasty, wood, with a tart sour finish.

Tap to glass @ Russian River Brewing tap room@ Santa Rosa,CA
A: Brown; medium head goes away fast, lacing
A: like basi/sugarcane vinegar
T: medium sourness, 
MF: smooth
OA: Very good beer for the style,ok to repeat, not to look for- not my preferred style,
Drank: April 14, 2016

37.5cl corked and caged bottle via trade. Massive thanks to Ryan for this one! It pours a clean dark copper color with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet acidic tangy winey with notes of blueberries, wine barrel, esters, lemon juice, light balsamic vinegar, tart cherries. Taste is also big sweet fruity tart acidic and lightly funky. Plenty notes of blueberries, lemon juice, tart cherries, light vinegar, white wine barrel and esters. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, very tasty and balanced, top notch

Bottle shared with koleminer20, yes. Bottled on March 13, 2015. Aroma is barrel, sour, tart, currants, red wine, lovely. Appearance is red purple, off white head, looks great. Taste is wine barrel, boozy, skins, currants, tannins, really good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light body, wine barrel aftertaste. Overall, I like this one a lot.
Bottle shared by Mike. Murky mahogany red with almost no head. Not as tart as Id imagined. Great berry fruit with some funk. Pretty well-rounded.

Thin head with a deep brown brew that is pretty cloudy when held to a light.

Very rich aroma.. very fruity and only mildly funky... tart berries.. whaffs woodiness .. grape bubblegum or soda.. 

tannic berry skins and an abundant fruitiness... some black cherry essence... maybe even some black caps... more oak than the nose .. a little lactic ... some wet leather and wild strawberry essence shows as it warms ... fantastic body for a sour... carbonation seems abundant but helps balance the slightly heavier mouthfeel ...

Den Haag tasting at Maakuns. Cloudy brown flat. Caramel brown sour grapes, Wood, walnuts, wild yeast. Fierce sour, brown sugar sweet. Smooth fizzy mineral texture medium body. Very grapes and pits,light bitter. Good brown sour. Like this!

Bottle shared, thanks to Santa bytemesis for sending this! Deep reddish brown with short lasting beige head that leaves no lacing. Bitter herbs, dried red fruits, overripe berries, peach, dried apple, sherry, balsamico, light caramel. Light sweet and sour with medium bitterness. Medium bodied with prickly carbonation. Nice, but a bit too herbal for me. Still a pleasure to try it.
@ Russian River 16-3-7: En mycket komplex öl som är vinös med tydliga toner av nötter och russin.. Syrlig och torr.

Bottle 0.33l from luttonm.Thanks bro.Bottled August 2014.Taste at Tommie birthday party Pozarevac Serbia.11.01.2016.Pour it little bit hazy brown color with no head.Aroma red fruita, cherries mainly, aceto balsamico.Taste start with salty black olives, wood, pinch tobacco, red wine,tart finish.It is quite complexed and really nice.Smooth wooden carachter.
Brown. Very tart but not puckering. Somewhat dry. Currants. Fairly flat. Batch 008. Tasted at tims moby dicks share. Thx chris.
Lots of berries and grapes in the aroma. Vinegary taste, with good length. Not a lot of balance.

Small off white head, mostly created from very high carbonation that keeps bubbles flowing to the top of the beer. Clear Ruby mahogany colour. Sour, tart dark fruit. Sour flavour, light chocolate, dark fruit, raspberry, cherry, very subtle funk. High carbonation, medium light mouthfeel, dry finish. Very nice blend of complexity.

310ml bottle. 9/17/15 bottle date. Appearance: Deep brown, clear, with a ruby red hue. Fizzy carbonation on the pour, with an off white head that dissipated quickly. 
Aroma: Vinous sour cherry upfront, slight oak and berry character. Lactic acid noticeable. 
Taste: Rich malt sweetness, loads of dark fruit character, some light toasted oak, and a Cabernet note shows up on the swallow. Lactic sourness strong throughout, but builds to sharp bite at the finish. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with a high carbonation. Very little evidence of the 10% ABV. 
Finish: Lingering cherry and lactic tartness 
Overall: An outstanding sour brown. Loads of dark fruit flavor highlighted by cherry, with a Cabernet vinous character throughout. Amazing complexity for a sour
Bottle at home, thanks to tderoeck for sharing! Lots of funk, whinish notes. Sour but not disturbing like some american sours. Oaky, leathery. Some red fruits. Good beer.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 batch 1001x4. Pour dark red with thin ecru head. Nose light funk, red wine, tart cherry, definitely fruit character. Taste nice tart up front, currant, plum, fig, trace of citrus and just a hint of anise. Some sweet malt late palate. Sweet and tart finish. Great flavors and complexity for an old beer.

28/I/16 - 37.5cl bottle from a trade @ ElMananas place - BB: n/a, bottled: II/11/14 (2016-84) Thanks to halo3one for the trade!
Clear purple dark beer, small aery irregular head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: fruity, funky, vinous notes. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sour, funky, bit leathery, more funk. Aftertaste: sourish, bit funky, acidic, some tannins, fruity, red berries.

Draft sample at the brewpub, Santa Rosa. Medium copper coloured pour with a fading greyish head. Aroma is sharp plum, gooseberry, tart plum, some alcohol. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, plum and apricot jam, some toffee, mellow tartness. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Lingering spicy fruit, apricot. A little boozy.

Pours brownis red, bit of foam. Aroma has berries, bit of funk. Taste has some intense sour, winevarrel oak and some numb bitterness coming through. Feels sort of winey, carbonation is good. Getting some currants, not only sure if red or black ones. Real solid sour, depth is there and also loads of flavour - and alcohol is nowhere to be seen.

Pours a dark red, murky body with a thin tan head. Aroma is just perfect!!! Cherries, leather, oak, red wine. Taste is slightly worse with strong wine and barrel notes covering everything. When warmer, it does get better, with lacto and cherries making an entrance. Body is light to medium with medium carbonation. Very nice!

Bouteille 375ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur couleur rouge vin foncé, mousse beige évanescente, film sur les parois du verre. Arôme fruité, boisé, vinaigre balsamique, vineux, cuir, côté porto. Goût de malt grillé/caramélisé, bonne acidité, alcool, boisé, côté sauvage, cassis en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-dense, astringente.

thx to Tom10101 :-) 16-1-16 - bottle-0,375L. Batch 007 from 2011 -my 60ieth style. Reddish/mahogany body, very clear, beige head, fast diminishing, but who cares. Aroma is Fruit, Brett, Wood with a small vinegar touch. citric tartness and tannin stand against wood, tobacco, leather and hints of fruit - great sour beer!

Bottle tasted twice, first time few months ago in Rome at B&F pub courtesy of Manuele. Second time in Serbia, courtesy of luttonm bottled August 2014. Many thanks to both! Pours a deep dark amber color, quite ruby highlights with a no-foam. Nose: red fruit, red wine vinegar, black olives, a bit liquor. Mouth: extremely tart, a bit astringent but so much character. Macerated berries, vinegar, some wood. Extreme and tasty. The bottle at Manuele was better.

375mL bottled 6/7/15, drunk 1/5/16, thanks to JoeT!Great appearance, with a deep auburn-mahogany colored body with great clarity and a light beige head atop that is small, but is surprisingly well-retained.Unfortunately, its quite boozey in the nose. Cant really get around it. It doesnt help the dry, bready, biscuity malts and light tannins, not to mention the currants and acidity from the bacteria. That being said, other than the heat, the nose is superbly balanced between yeast, wood, wine, fruit and malt. Plentiful black currant, black pepper, soft funk and light cherry-prune character to enjoy, with a good strength and a touch of almond and light brandy. Finally, with about 1/5 of the glass left, the alcohol burned off and what remained was truly divine. Guess I should have let it breath longer.In the mouth, the beer is less given to the alcohol, with tons of cherry, raisin, caramelized brown sugar and strong acidity to balance. Light balsam-like flavors, with a more dry wood character and piquant currant notes. Acetic character does not grow heavy and hangs in balance with the lactic acids. Wonderfully attenuated, though with enough body left to prevent any tannic astringency or overdose of acidity. Light grape, plum, brown sugar and black pepper linger on, with lip-smacking acidity. Tight carbonation. Seems like this stuff would age very well for a years to come.

bottled on Sept 2015, again its surprisingly smooth drinking despite the young age and high alcohol contents. pours copper hue with little head it has sour dough aroma with citrus accent. the flavor is citrus and kombucha. well balanced.
Aroma is full of oak must and sour zest. Taste is sweet and sour. Leaves a slight sour taste. Look brown red with no head. Nice and sour.

From a bottle. Pours clear, dark caramel with fizzy off-white head. Smells like balsamic vinegar, cereal and toasted malts, vanilla, oak, and dates. Tastes like bready malt, some caramel, dark fruit, sour notes, and some subtle acidity. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle. Pours dark amber. Aroma is Sour and wine. Taste is sour barrel with a dry fruity wine finish. Pretty good.

[Bottle] Pours reddish-brown with almost no head. Aroma is awesome. Leathery, acetic acid, berry, subtle vanilla; lots of barrel in general, but in all the right ways. Taste is outstanding too. Oak again, fairly tart, good amount of fruit that is well integrated--would have probably have pegged this as raspberry or blackberry, some alcohol. Pretty dry, long finish that is great--leathery. Overall, this is just an excellent beer. I wish I had bought more of this while I was out in California.
Bottle from Michael Burd -- cheers, buddy! Tart, dark, and complex, with distinct oak and fruit flavor, balanced by a sizable sourness. This is the kind of beer that wine country does best.

Tap at russian river, santa rosa. Dark reddish brown color, white head. Supreme aroma has oak, creamy notes, caramel and chocolate. Taste has chocolate, berries, oak, some wine notes and smooth palate.
Pours a slightly cabonated deep reddish brown. Nice oak wine aroma. Taste is nice and tart, but smooth and sweet at the same time. Can really pick up on the oak.

Review from notes. Mahogany color with beige head. Aroma is really fruit forward with the currants making me think of blackcurrant wine. Also some caramel and wood notes. Taste is sweet with fruits and caramel notes at first but gets intensely sour and acidic on the finish and aftertaste. You can get a bit of warming alcohol too. Really nice fruit profile and complex taste.

This is the best sour Ive ever had. I joked that it tasted more like red wine than beer after each sip, but it really does combine the best of both very effectively. Its sweet and its sour and its easy to smell all the complex goings-on from the currants fermenting in the oak barrels. Id drink this again and again.

From a 375 ml bottle into a Leffe glass. Batch "004x4." Pours brown with minimal head and lace. Aroma of fermented cherries and oak. Significant carbonation and big mouthfeel. Flavors of tart apricot, cherries, apple, plums, currant, and slight malt. Overall mouth puckering tart with a fruity complexity.

Un grand merci à Yan pour le partage! Une belle sour rouge à laméricaine au collet monté et au look défiant. Dimportantes arômes de vin rouge émanent de mon verre. Ça sent le vieux baril oublié dans une grange de campagne à la fonte des neiges. Oui ça sent vraiment ça! À ce vieux bois presque pourri sajoute un vinaigre important qui flirt doucement avec lalcool dont on sent à peine les 10 degrés. Une belle rondeur en bouche pour une bière aigre, sans doute attribuable au Cabernet Sauvignon sans lequel la bière aurait été plutôt difficile à boire. Très réussie!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle shared at a tasting. Thanks Jon! Pours a clear orange-amber with a small off-white head. Cab-forward nose with lots of dark fruit: cassis, plum and juicy red grapes with some oak and light vanilla as it warms. Again the nose is very vinous with good tart character. Average carbonation with a medium body. Fruit forward on the palate with some light oak. Dry finish with good sourness. Awesomeness.
Bottle, thanks Jon. Nice. Very rounded, rich and fruity, light booziness, wine. Aroma has funk, fruit, sourness. Booze only comes at the end. Almost liqueur like. Very nice.

Poured into a wine glass showing translucent caramel with sparse white foam around the rims. 

The nose is without a doubt, very Cabernet Sauvignon forward, with a big dark fruit notes of plums, cassis, and blackberries in a big oak background. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and light bodied. Highly tart with a big Cabernet Sauvignon forwardness of the same flavors as the nose. The oak is surprisingly light.
Light brown color. Huge cab, oak and sour nose. The mouth is super light for 10% with lots of oak, cherries, green apples and tons of sourness. Soon good.

Bottle, vintage 2014. Pours clear dark amber with tiny beige head. Aroma is packed with funky goodness, vanilla, oak, vinegar, wood, candy, cherries, red berries, red wine, some parfume, earthy and light tobacco. Taste is pretty intense and dense, deep balsamic, dried fruits, berries, fruity, really mellow at first, like the aroma, then super sour. Some candy and still really fruity and light tobacco woody feel. Warming alcohol and tart finish with good portion of tannins. Fizzy carbonation.

375 ml bottle at home, thanks TimVim! Reddish amber with tiny beige head. Aroma faint, bready malt, sour, funky, wine barrel, grapes. Taste is bready, tart, sour, grapes, grape juice, barrel, funky brett notes with a bitter spur finish with lots of grapes. Nice!

Awesome! Poured a dark murky brown with nice poofy head and great lacing. Complex malts helped retain nice head. Delicious rich aromas of oak cellar wine raspberries cherries and tint of bourbon vanilla. The sourness was well balanced by the strong wine and vanilla bourbon flavors. Very balanced and complex. If you like wine beer and bourbon this one is for you A Plus.

A simply amazing brew. Pours a murky, opaque burgundian brown with a few beige bubbles forming a head. The aroma is rich, heavy with funk notes, vanilla, raisin and currant dried fruit notes and a plethora of funky barrel notes. First sip is a bit sweet with an underlying vanilla-esque and woody barrel note. Light sugary currant and raisin notes, heavy oak and caramel malts. The beer is in exquisite balance with the finish filled with tart, acetic notes and a ton of funky farmhouse notes. A simply delightful beer!

375 mL bottle, brought to Ale Alpharetta by Hamp. Pours a nice ruby brown, with no head. The nose is caramel, tart black cherries, black pepper, syrup, and a touch of rye. Very sweet and syrupy, with a nice, sharp sourness. Medium to heavy body, syrupy, sharp and fairly acidic. This is a nice dark sour - complex, rich and vinous.

Pours fairly clear mahogany with a nice pale tan head. Fruity aroma has notes of dark fruit plus some apple, and a bit of malt. Tart flavor pleases with notes of apple and cherry as well as hints of plum, banana and malt. Firm body titllates with a persistent and satisfying tingle. Consecrate a glass today.

courtesy of Thomas Schneider - hazy brown beer with a modest foam left; decently woody aroma with fair notes of cherries and hints of vinegar; full-bodied, lively and a bit chewy; assertive, tasty and effervescent; long woody cherryish, prune and vinegar-like finish, solidly sourish with lingering notes of rhubarb; quite dry - huge beer !

A bottle at Tria in Philly, corked and caged. I went into this expecting something very different than what I got: expected heavy ethyl lactate, tobacco, intense acetic character, instead got incredibly dense leathery Brett that was bold and lasting, somewhat like smushed cherry fruit leather at times, but more often like actual leather, a Brett assault unique to my experience. Medium wood component that thankfully isnt gobsmackingly "oak" helps with the firm vinous character.  Lovely dark red hue, a touch sweet only to start (that quickly faded into roughness), not overtly/extremely sour (though a few bottles might have me worrying about heartburn), full, earth-rich, and complex, killer mouthfeel, simply world class. Only thing lacking for me was a better nose, and that owed probably to atmosphere; anyone willing to donate a bottle for home consumption can BM me for the address :)

375 ml swing top bottle. Pours a clear dark red/brown with light bubbly head. Aromas of oak, sour red berries and red wine vinegar. Flavors of cranberries, tart cherries, oak, and vinegar. Solid and quenching. But overpriced.

Sour wine grapes in nose. Some sour tart fruity aroma as well. Taste very crisp with very acidic tartness. Sparkling white wine fizz and quick disappearing head. Complex flavor of oak wine and wonderful fruits.

Nice clean aroma of lacto and funk. Pours a slightly hazy ruby red with a full light tan head. Theres a hint of sweetness at the beginning of this beer, perhaps from the currants. This sweetness fades quickly to a complex blend of sour, funk, tobacco, and a touch of wine. The sourness is not overpowering, and fades out quickly, leaving a touch of a tannic note. This is an amazing beer, and if you have the chance, you should try it.

Enjoyed from bottle dated 11/06/14. Good carbonation but no head on pour. Nice effervescence in glass. Very pleasant sour taste with cherry and currant tones present up front. Just the right amount of funk on this one. A real pleasure to enjoy. I wish Russian River still distributed in WA - I would drink this regularly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rosy brown. No head. Perfect cranberry, candied orange and vanilla with a hint of tartness on the nose. Aggressively tart, then it opens into a twist of vanilla, a burst of orange, then a long sweet grape/Berry fruitiness. A touch of dry wood too. Really immaculate stuff.
smells like fruit and tobacco leaves. Pours a copper colour with no head. Tart taste of dried fruit slightly sour with crisp tart finish.

Poured from a bottle. Medium copper color, no real head. Light fruit aroma. Medium body with a quick slight tart fruit flavor and a lift finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of cigar leaf, raisins, and grapes. Pours a clear copper color, no head. A mildly sour taste with hints of grapes, tobacco and raisins. Delicious with a light body and a mildly tart finish.
Poured from a bottle. Little head, effervescent and yellow-orange. The aroma is a decent sour, very tasty taste. Tobacco and lemon.
Another awesome brew from RR. Dark fruits and dark malts. Mostly caramel and some tartness. Wine like of dark Cabernet and some Pinot noir character. Finishes sherry like with evident carbonation.
Ruddy brown pour. Awesome tart aroma of cherry, chocolate, plum and red wine. Flavor is simply amazing. Tart and fruity, with cherry, raspberry, plum, peach, and red wine. Rich, dry and tannic.

Brown bottle, 375 ml, bottled on 112213, savoured on May 1st 2015; eye: brown with a ruby hue, semi-opaque, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: black currant, wild yeasts, woody, tannin, intense, light residual sugar; mouth: black currant, wild yeasts, woody, tannin, intense, light residual sugar, finale in black currant with presence of small berries acridness, medium-full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, slick texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille brune, 375 ml, embouteillée 112213, savourée le 1er mai 2015; il : brune avec une teinte rubis, semi-opaque, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : cassis, levures sauvages, boisé, tanin, intense, léger sucre résiduel; bouche : cassis, levures sauvages, boisé, tanin, intense, léger sucre résiduel, finale en cassis avec légère présence dâcreté, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

An essay in balance, as rich caramel malt combines with super plummy, raisiny character and vivid dark berry and bing cherry fruit. Finishes on a subtly intertwined sour note. Long fniish, all in finesse.
Bottle, shared at RBAG 2015 by Sid. Batch 007 from 2011. Very hazy golden amber, sour cherries and bready caramel, yoghurt and light funk. I could crush a lot of this
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Sampler at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Copper-amber color with small white ring. Oaky, apple tartness, plumbs, caramel. Still definitely a Sour Red, but it?s American - undoubtful. Taste is heavy on the lemon citrusness, but also plums, candied apples, and a bit bitter - feels like a heavy french red-wine, quite tanninic. Perfect mouthfeel. A truly great beer.

Colored a deep crimson-brown, with a little yellow at the edges. Smell is of caramel malts and syrupy molasses. Carbonation is noticeable in the nose and almost burns the nostrils if you whiff too close. Flavor is two-sided: malt up front, tartness in the back. Barrel-aging produced a very pronounced wood flavor, almost like chewing on a piece of oak. You get a blast of orangey lemon citrus just at the swallow. Tartness is most noticeable as you begin to drink, but the dark, rich, woody flavors come after the swallow and builds after each sip. Medium body. Heavily carbonated almost to champagne levels, but it works. A complex and delicious brew, with each flavor pairing beautifully and playing off the others. Bottles empty themselves quickly in my presence.
Wood and tart plum aroma. Flavor of tartness malts and dark fruits. Finishes dry and plumb wine like.

3 oz chilled pour from tap into cylindrical taster as part of Russian Rivers everything on tap sampled (16 beers this time around) at the brewery itself. I realize that drinking 16 different 3 oz pours is not ideal for proper rating, but when will I ever have an opportunity like this again?

Tastes like a very sour cider. Bit fruity, but in a different kind of way.

37.5 cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours reddish brown/deep amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is grape, sour fruit, oak, overripe fruit and currants. Flavour is acidic sour and a little funky. Medium bodied, slick texture, fizzy carbonation.
One of the best beers of Russian River ive ever tryed.awesome well balance between sour, wood and final taste.great aroma

Reserve Bottle Program at Russian River. 750 mL bottle from Batch 2 bottled on 30 March 2009. The pour is a dark brownish red with a thin ring of light egg shell colored head and no lace. The aroma is a little winey but the oak, currants, and malts are really good. The aroma is so well melded. The flavor is excellent. A little grape, a lot of currant, and some wonderful oak. Its definitely dry as well. Sharp and tart. The mouth feel is good. Its dry, but moderately viscous. The carbonation is just about perfect, even after all these years. The aftertaste is lingeringly winey and full of sharp dry currants. Great beverage ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at the Russian River Brewing Co, Santa Rosa, CA.
Clear dark copper colour with a sweet off-white head.
Mild sourness, woody notes, red wine, sugar and dark fruits in the aroma. 
Redcurrant, tartness, moderate sourness, red wine and sweetness in the flavour. Balanced and tasty.
Rust color, no real head but some sparkling carbonation. Great balance flavor if sour tartness and some rose wine character. Finishes with a light oak and cigar box flavor.
This beer has a rich brown color no head. It has a very sour aroma. It definitely has wine like flavors and is amazingly smooth and light for 10%.

Bottle: Dreary copper-brown color with a slight ruby-mahogany tint. Muddled & opaque. Murky beige collar on top. Aroma is fruit forward; tons of black currant, grape, cherries, red wine, & mixed berries. Soft sourness with a bit of fruity sweetness underneath. Notes of wet wood, a touch of Brett & hay-like funk, & some faint tobacco. Flavor is more sour than the nose, for sure. Balsamic vinegar, light acidity with lots of grape, berry, plum, currant, & black cherry. Oak peaks in & out with a hefty dryness & a touch of musty funk. Very juicy. Acetic, but not overbearing. Wine-like finish, very dry but also lingering with a strong tartness & some mild driftwood. Cant really taste the 10% ABV at all. Though far from my favorite RR sour, its still pretty damn good.

Au nez, c'est bien boisé, alcoolisé, sûr avec un bon goût de grains caramélisés. En bouche, on gout le bois, un côté sûr prononcé et fruité a la fois. La finale est boisée et sûre, balancée à la perfection. Incroyable produit qui vaut le cher coût...!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
on tap at the brewey; deep amber color; sour cherry aroma; fantastic sour cherry and dark fruit flavor with notes of red wine
Batch1x1 750. Still going strong. Incredible. Very sour, tobacco, molasses, malt, dark fig, more tobacco funk and rich dark fruit

Perfect complex sour. Dark sour fruits of plum and Cabernet type of grapes. Yeasty in good way, funky and oaky as well. Some barnwood and light cedar. Fruits sour fruits kept popping up all over. Awesome!

Very interesting brew here. After taste is sour like a sour patch kid. Literally finishes with a kick in your mouth. Your after buds will thank you for trying this beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On the tap at Blue Dog Chalfont as part of their Russian River Tap Takeover. Pours dark red-brown with a one finger off white head with decent lacing. Aroma is of sour fruits, funk, raisins,dark fruit,cherries, and vinegar, Taste is sour fruits, wet hay, funk, currants, toasted malts, cherries, and woody oak. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a pretty sour, bone dry, long, lingering finish. Overall, a excellent, world class sour brown that is just a tad below supplication.

375 mL bottle, won at Canberra brewers club raffle in late 2014. Bottled 052314, so drinking at ~9.5 months after bottling. 
Dark brown/red pour with minimal head, sour cherry aroma. Pleasant high carbonation. Sour lactic/acetic acid taste, acidity just right. Aroma has cherry, wood from the barrel, and red wine character. A world class sour beer. But bear in mind its a sour beer - be in the right mood when you open it.
Pours dark red with little head. Smell is sour funk, fruit, and red wine. Taste is red wine, grapes and funk. Rolls across the tongue sour but very crisp. Light body, high carb.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 On tap at the brewery. Pours dark golden honey color, small head. Aroma is sour, funk, raisins. Flavor is very tart, very sour. Smells pretty great but a bit acidic for me.
Excellent beer i love champagne and this thing give me both a champagne with a beer kind of taste, great!!!
Best sour ever! We all loved this! The oak smell make it seem harsh but the currents balance out the flavor and give it a sweet flavor
Wine, cherry nose. Clean acidity punctuated by tart cherry. Spritzy carbonation helps the beer vanish off the palate.

A Perfectly crafted Amber-Sour. The Lush Berry aroma lightly fill the air. The majestic flavors of Dark Fruit intertwined with Cab Oak offer the most unique first taste followed by a distinct & colorful Amber-Sour crescendo. An Experience in a Bottle.

Corked & caged bottle split 4 ways. Murky burgundy pour with some tiny lacings. Nose has balsamico, tart red berries, currants, cherries and some vanilla. Taste is light acidic, leather, vanilla, currants, balsamico, dark malts and with a light alcohol burn in the finish.
bottle. pours reddish golden color. cab comes through in a subtle way, light and fresh. great beer.
Perfect in all aspects. So great aroma of white wine grapes and peppery oak. Taste is tart with a vinous soothing flavor. Oak finish and lively carbonation. Awesome brew.

Bottle, 37,5cl corked and caged thanks to Erik. Pours a dark reddish, unclear brown with an off white, short lasting, fizzy head. Aroma has lots of oak, tobacco, darker malts, black currant, vinous, tart stuff. Taste is very tart at first, but has lots of deeper, darker malty and fruity notes. Some sweetness, but only just enough to balance the tart stuff. Alcohol is present for sure. Very nice and powerfull sour!! Full body and med high carbonation.

Bottle thanks (thanks!!!) to bursprak. Pours hazy reddish brown with some sediment. Aromas of sour berries, vinous currant notes, vanilla, vinegar, malts, vanilla, almondy sweetness, balsamico. Taste is sour currants, vinous notes, vanilla, vinegar, balsamico. This is goddamn speciel!

Yes a 5. Why? If this isnt a 5 than I dont know what is. If I find something better I will knock this down a click or two. Shared with Dan and Brian Ge at the house (on my birthday.) Small snifters. Pours a deep reddish brown with no head. The aroma is super tart fruits and red wine cabernet barrels. The taste is amazing balanced and smooth. Its not too tart or funky, just right. The blend of the dark fruits and the Cabernet barrel was spot on. The texture is awesome and light. Its just simply awesome.
@Monks Café in Philadelphia. Oak, vanilla, and dark fruits. Complex and very good!
Bottle. Pours a transparent dark amber with nonexistent head. Aroma and taste are amazing. Tart and sour. Malts.

Shared bottle. Pours clear, dark caramel with fizzy off-white head. Aroma is balsamic, cereal and toasted malts, vanilla, oak, and dates. Flavor is bready malt profile with some caramel, plenty of dark fruit sour notes, and some subtle acidity. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle from Nov 2013 drank Jan 2015. Pours with a vigorous fleeting head and deep ruby color. Aroma is very big red wine, must, berry, and deep sour. Flavor is very tart and forward currants with wine notes throughout. Its a bit sacrin sweet but balances by a dynamic interplay of everything else. It could age longer but is lovely now with no apparent signs of age. Feel is both citric and lively but dense and silken over a long finish. Even though I have had it a handful of times before this is astonishingly good.

750 ml bottle from batch 1 X 003 I think from notes. Pours a dark reddish brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have big tart/sour berries and dark fruit character, oak, cherry, vanilla, funk, some vinegar comes through, the cab barrel influences are noticeable and work well with the base beer. Absolutely no sign of the 10 %. Another solid RR beer

Many thanks to Michael for the bottle.

Pours a fiery dark red color, with a fizzy, small head.

Smells of an intriguing tart funkiness, part barnyard, part sour, fermented fruit. Both smells blend very well together, supported by a pleasant, wooden malt note. The currants got a sweet, pungent hint to them, which enhances their sour aspect. The fruitiness turns even more present, while the brew warms up.

Begins with musty, wooden malts, joined by prickly currants, on which a dry, funky sourness settles, accompanying the fruity acidity. The barrel character provides wooden oak qualities, setting the balance of the beer. Then the sourness gets even dryer and more acidic, drying-out the tongue. Drinks dangerously easy, the alcohol is extremely well hidden. Finishes with matured, slightly wooden, leathery malts, with the addition of ripe grapes, while the tartness covers the outside of my teeth, leaving back a melange of joung currants and slick acidity.

Excelente sour barrel-aged da Russian River. Vermelho-escura, com média formação de espuma, desprendendo aroma cítrico e vínico, com notas secundárias de oxidação, como molho inglês e cassis. Na boca, acidez pronunciada, com baixo amargor, corpo baixo e boa carbonatação, permanecendo as notas vínicas do aroma, seguidas da percepção do barril e envelhecimento. Final seco, ácido. Excelente breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of dark cherry, vinegar and alcohol. Pours a coke colour with no head or lacing. Taste is sour black cherry, vinegar (not too much), nice nutty dry finish. I always equate a good sour to eating a good sharp cheese. I love this one.

Pours a deep caramel brown, reminds me of Cola. Very lively in the glass with no head. Smells like red grape and cherries though aroma is weak. Taste is tart initially, followed by vinous and cherry notes.
on tap ramata nocciola vinosa liquorosa amaro cognac fruttata tannino aspra buona acidita tabacco

Compliments of my bro Bytemesis! Bottle pours a reddish brown with a thin ice tea head. Aromas of cherry, oak barrel, and distinct Cabernet. Flavor is intensely complex sour and tart cherries. You do not drink this, you experience it. Yum.

Bottle from Felix.
Pours ruby red, a fizzy head rests down to a ring around the edge of the glass.
Aroma has loads of red currants, slight yeast and funk, wet wood, perhaps some leather, slight alcohol.
Taste is a really great blend of tartness, woody dryness and some slight sweetness hidden somewhere in between; currants, cherries, some red wine and earthy bitterness, vingeary tartness, cigar as well?
Medium body, high prickly carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Something strange in the after taste, cant put my finger on it. Overall, a very good take on the Flemish red ale!

On tap at Russian River. Pours slightly porterish color. Aroma is port, sour cherry, lemon, roast, caramel. So much complexity. Taste is sour cherry, coffee, and roast fading into lemon juice, lemon zest, long finish.
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pours reddish brown with no head. Strong sour cranberry grape smell. Good sour grape flavor. Great beer.
10/14/2014. From bottle. Medium brown with a tan head. Funky sour aromas with hints of wine and oak. Not overly sour, but very balanced and complex. Truly an awesome beer.
Great beer. Cellared for four years. The sour flavor is pretty subtle, but its there.

i liked it, but i havent had a good bottle of consecration since then. the nose was like creamed black cherries, prickly barnyard and Rodenbach-like flemish red yeast with a heavy wood presence and it seemed to be around 7-8%, but recent bottles are a mess: aspirin/vitamins/minerals/gravel combined with excessive alcohol..

No retention and no lacing. Smells of black current, sour fruits and oak. Tastes of sour cherries, oak and wine. Sour aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

10/12/14. Bottle drank the night of the "blackout Eagles Giants game" and Season5 The Walking Dead premier. Great beer!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is probably as close to a perfect beer as Ill get. Pours dark plum with limited head and limited lacing. Nose is black currents and some candy. Flavours of candy, black currents, maybe some strawberries, sour. Taste is light/med sweet medium sour limited bitter. Full sticky body with a long sour aftertaste. Wow.

Bottle. Pours ruby mahogny in color with an off-white head. Dark fruits, garden apples, some oak and barrel notes and bit of funky cherries in aroma. Nice one so far and even if it feels quite complex its very balanced somehow. The first sip introduces some cherries and dark fruits mixed together with notes of red wine, bit of spices as well. Vinegar and funky notes appears later on. Nice tasting on the whole with some vinous plums and bit of tart fruity notes in the end.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Great balance of mild sourness and currants.
Acid et sure mais pas trop, peu de sucre, un arrière goût qui rappelle le vin . Un peu boisé. Excellent.
Very tart, but in all the best ways. Little sticky on the palate so best to pair with something to nibble on. Not too sweet, not too bitter. Sour, sparkling and refreshing.

Pours a clear dark garnet in color with little head. Sour nose with aromas of cherry, oak, and a little funk. Tart bite. Flavors of sour cherry, currants, and hint of oak. Has a good bit of tannins as well. Reminds me of a Cabernet Sauvignon with a slightly sweet and sour mixed. Great balance and complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very boozy sour ale. Sips like a fine wine, very minerally texture. Stinky cheese surprises on the nose.

Amber brown, tan head great carbonation, could smell the complex woody malts from a mile away. Flavor has a complex vinious brown malt with some sour notes. Oak comes through in the multi dimensional A+ brew

Bottle shared with Belgbeergeek . 
Pours redbrown / no real head . 
Smell is fleshy , oak, fruity , sour . 
Taste is dry , sour, oak , fruity . 
Nice and intense taste !

Bottle. Amber brown. Sour dark fruit aroma with a bit of an odd skunky note. The taste adds oak and a lot of Cabernet tanin notes. Cherry, raisin, light chocolate after it warmed. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark clear brown with almost no head. Aroma is dark fruit, red wine and musty funk. Taste is a little rubbery up front and adds some lactic notes and wood from the barrel. Medium sticky mouthfeel with no carb. Very tasty.

Bottle from a friend. Smell is sour and has notes of citrus and some fruits. Pours a dark amber colour with a medium beige head. Taste is subtle sour but at the same time fresh and enjoyable. Palate and body is thin though the taste lingers in mouth. An enjoyable beer which, despite its sourness, is very fresh.

Bottle. Pours a deep, deep garnet with a high, fine-grained, just off-white lacy head. That is an amazing nose; as I poured it waves of sour, fruity, woody, aroma came wafting towards me. Theres also notes of red wine and an acetic element. On the tongue, theres a tart punch right up front, shifting quickly into the roundness of dark fruit, oak, and vinification; while theres no sweetness, there is definitely a complex and deep element that keeps it from being too thin and emphatic in its sourness. I cannot recall ever having a sour that was this rich. Finish is long, fruity, tannic, and smoky. This might be the best sour Ive ever had.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Bottle from my awesome landlord. Poured reddish brown with min head. Aroma very acidic sour some funk wine grape. Med carb and bod. Tingly fruit grape sour taste. Bleh.

Pours I deep redish amber, almost like a watered down cab. Poured into a tulip glass. Slight red hue on head that quickly diminishes. Aroma of sour cherry and dark fruit. Slight sweetness that fades into tart candy in the most pleasant way.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Luxurious specialty fruit beer aged on wine barrels. Bottle generously donated by the brewer during his visit to a friend of mine, the owner of my local pub in Ghent...  Loose, quickly dissolving, off-white foam, colour a misty brownish copper. Powerful, vinous and very fruity aroma of sherry, cassis, passion fruit, balsamic vinegar, sour cherries, hay, old port wine, tobacco, wood; taste begins with a very lively, opulent fruitiness, sweetish, obviously a lot of cassis with a sharp lemony accent, drying the palate till deep into the finish, all built on a soft, caramelly and chocolatey maltiness, smooth, complex, wood in the finish with very light hoppiness and warming, sherry-like alcohol. Interesting, very vinous beer, almost like a (very strong) oud bruin.
Fad: Taster og pint på brewpub. Amerikansk sur når det er bedst. Rødbrun klar med et lille skumhoved. God duft af aceto. Smagen er kompleks med masser forskellige noter af surhed. Lækker lækker øl.

Bottle thanks to Beechner224. Pours a very nice dark red color. Aroma is a lot of oak. Some fruitiness. Taste is very tart. oak in the back end. it stays with you for a while. Very good. Drinks easier than the ABV. I like it.
Bottle from batch 008. Pours a dark ruby red, pretty much no head. Aroma is sweet fruit, tart strong. Taste is sweet, tart, lip puckering. Not sure what currants are, but this is damn tasty.

Poured from a bottle. An apology gift bottle! (All is forgiven, Drew). Aroma is of cherries and wine. Great mouthfeel. Tastes of cherries, red wine, dark fruits, yeast, and belgian ale. Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from Bottle into tulip glass. 

Appearance: Dark amber color, beautiful carbonation streams, and yeast floating around. A firm and smooth one finger head until the bottom of glass. Lovely foam streamers left around the glass.

Aroma: More malty than I expected. At first reminded me of a caramel heavy barley wine. Strong sour scent next with strong lemon tones. Dark fruit smell from raisins and prunes. 

Taste: Lemon warhead candy, red wine, vanilla from oaky wood. Touch of caramel malt in the back ground. This is probably the best sour I have ever had. 

Mouthfeel: Strong sour cringe, with smooth flow. Carbonation is mild and smooth, and a bit astringent in the back. 10% ABV is noticed in the swallow with minor burn

Overall: FANTASTIC! Highly recommend to anyone who can get their hands on it.

Draft at brewery. Nose is a blast of cheery a d grape with a fruit roll up character. Some winey and wood cone through in the flavor. Very acidic and chest burning. Seems to mask the enjoy ability of the fruity expression. Wood really comes through as it warms up.

375ml bottle, bottled on 2/11/14. Very strong red wine aroma with notes of currants. Pours dark brown tinged ruby colored with a thin off-white head and no lacing. Highly carbonated, what head there was initially burned off quickly. Taste starts sweet with currant notes with vinous undertones. Finishes quite tart with a red wine flavored palate that lingers. Very nice sour.

Bottle from Lectvay, thanks again good sir! Wonderful ruby/brown pour. Aromas of wine barrels and berries. Wow this just smells amazing. Flavor is sweet and tart currants. Wonderful acidity and just a touch of oak. Delicious brew. Definitely lives up to the hype.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, batch 005X2E. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep ruby red color with a small fairly dense off white head with decent retention, that reduces to a ring of lacing fairly quickly. Slight spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour cherry, green apple, raisin, plum, fig, red wine, oak, clove, hay, straw, leather, musty funk, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast, oak barrel, and fruit notes; with good strength. Taste of big sour cherry, green apple, raisin, plum, fig, red wine, oak, hay, straw, leather, musty funk, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Good amount of fruity/earthy sourness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour cherry, green apple, raisin, plum, fig, red wine, oak, hay, straw, leather, musty funk, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast, oak barrel, and fruit flavors; with a great sweetness/sourness balance and no cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a smooth, acidic, and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only small warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome fruited wild ale. All around great complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast, oak barrel, and fruit flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Draft as part of the full sampler at Russian River. Slightly hazy brown/amber with off-white head. Aromas of cherries, dark fruit, vinegar. Tastes of oak, cherries, dark fruit. Medium-light body with a very dry finish. Good stuff.

Pours like a wine. Deep reddish brown body with nearly no head. Highly carbonated. Nose of vinegar, balsamic, sour cherries and wood. Flavour of very very tart. Great cherry base with a lasting acidic finish. Very satisfying. 12.68fl oz bottle. Courtesy of Blomster. Thanks so much Christer!

My God.... This is wonderful. Its pours an absolutely gorgeous dark plum color, and smells sweet and wonderful. It tastes immediately sour and then settles down so you can enjoy all of the currant and malts. It finishes so smooth, you would never know it is 10%. I love this beer.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with red hues and off-white head. Aroma is very oaky, wood, dark fruits, sour. Taste is woody, sweet and sour, ripe berries, lots of wine. Really delicious!

Poured from bottle to glass. Copper amber hue with off white fizzy head. Aroma is lactic, oak, sour cherry, wine grapes, acetic, malic. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and fizzy carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with tart sourness exploding through the finish and wrapping up with a nice tannin finish. Overall this is an exceptional sour brew!

Great sour. Pours dark with almost no head. The taste is of cherries and currants. The high ABV is hidden well. Overall one of the best and well balanced sours I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark ruby looking almost identical to a port wine with thin white head that quickly fades. Aroma is very complex. Smells vinous with the Cabernet definitely prominent. Cherry, prune, figs,, plums, brown sugar. Taste is very similar to smell. Moderate to heavy sweetness followed by a moderate sour flavor. I'm not a big sour fan but this is very good. Medium bodied with sticky and clingy mouthfeel. Flavors of cherry, prune, Cabernet. From a guy who is not a big sour fan even I'll admit this is a very complex and tasty beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle share. Batch 013113. Pours a cloudy burnt red. Aroma of dark fruit, wine. Taste is tart. Brilliant crisp mouthfeel and dry finish.

Draft at brewpub. Pours slightly garnet hued porterish color. Aroma is currants, port, sour cherry, lemon, roast, caramel. So much complexity. Taste is sour cherry, coffee, and roast fading into lemon juice, lemon zest, long finish. Amazing. Probably my favorite regularly available Russian River sour.

Draught at Westend tavern. Dark ruby color, white head. Bitter/sour taste with tart, cherry, acidic notes, tannins, hops and ripe fruits. Bitter/sour finish with cherry, ripe fruits and tart. Exquisite sour red.

Aroma of dark fruit, wood, vanilla. Taste is dark fruit and woody. Get some of the peppery flavors from the cab barrels and other wine flavors. So complex and so many flavors. Full flavored. Well balanced for a sour. Lactic but maybe 6 or 10. Could be more lactic but the amount of lactic sour is balanced. 340 ratings before giving a 5, but I think this deserves it. Absolutely an amazing sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The smell is dried fruit, sour/tart cherries, hint of sweet booze, the look is murky brown with a little light coming thru. White low head, the taste is tart, fruit, boozy, but smooth. Even after the swallow the sour taste is smooth. I know many cant get a hold of this, but if you do, you will agree its the best sour out there, no question!

Sampled at Russian River, Santa Rosa, CA. The taster glass arrived with virtually no head on this dark brown/hint of red wine-colored beer. Aroma is complex: sour cherries, wood and yeast. Flavor is tart and funky - delicious and quenching. Finish is vinegar and puckering. Delicious. From notes 2/19/13.
Their sours never fail...nice tart aroma and darker than most sours, and while I prefer some of the ones aged in white wine barrels, this is impressive.

Batch 03X2. Hazy ruby-orange. Aroma is strongly tart, with wet wood & slightly rotting fruit. Flavour - bracingly tart & sour fruit with wood & caramel background. Some vinous notes, a bit of leather & tobacco. Feels a bit tired, but still a pretty great beer.

On tap at Russian River Brewery - Aroma of currents, vinous, and Brett. Pours a dark translucent mahogany with no head or lacing. The taste is amazing! Vinous, Brett, currents and lip puckering sourness. Medium-light body and moderate carbonation. Overall, I am moving to CA! This is an nice sour beer'

Pour was dark amber with no head but a lively carbonation. Got a winey nose with a little funk to it. A little wood taste, a little funk. Tart and tasty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had thanks to VanS in a trade. Pours amber with a light head. What every sour wants to be. What a great beer. The sharpness of the cherries and level of sourness is perfect.
Superb! Wood, earth, barnyard. Focused on dark fruit, currants, black cherry, plum. Perfect balance, great sourness. Long unbelievable finish. Im in heaven ....
Bottle Batch 7 - Pours a murky brown. Lots of currants, winey, grape, and funky in the aroma. The taste is very tart w/ a strong taste of the currants, grapes, and dates. Pretty solid!!!

On tap poured a ruby red hue w/ thin mostly diminishing head w/ visible alcohol breaking up the lacing. Moderate wine aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a bold sour finish. Tastes are wine, oak, bretty funk, milk, currants and truffles. Full bodied and lasting Brett in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fantastic beer! Pours a dark red/brownish color and smells like wine, tart fruit, slight booze, wine, and oak. Taste is tart apple, slight oak and winey as well. Nice champagne like carb. Overall phenomenal and I will definitely have again

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark orange brown beer with a small white head. Smells medium sour, little butter. Tastes heavy sour, vinegar. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.
Bottle @ van moll tasting. Brown red color. Sweet and tastes fruity, sweet, sour, wine.

Bottle @ Van Moll Tasting shared by Joes. Batch 002X3. Clear dark amber, deep red color, small off-white to beige head. Smell and taste sourish, red fruits, sour cherries or sour red berries, sharp sourness, wooden barrel. Medium dry finish, medium body, medium carbonation. Certainly a nice beer, but too sharp sour for me.

Bottle @ Proeftafel Van Moll. Amber colour with a small off-white head. Smells sourish, brown sugar, cherry, red fruits. Tastes sour, red fruits, intense sour. Medium body, soft carbo, lasting sourness.
Pours amber with thin white head. Rich fruit, wine and tart aroma. Oak, red wine, fruit, tart and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a tart fruity finish.
A strong beer, starting to taste more like a wine. Its good though, fruity and sour.
Bottle from Healthy Spirits, SF. Pours ruby and hazy. Sour cherry and dark bready malt aroma. Very sour, with some dark fruits. Tart finish. Smooth full body. Nice.

Gift from bmmillsy. Brown, amber, mahogany. Thin lacing. Butterscotch, fruity (apple, cherry, pear), sour, bread. Delectable. This sour has tremendous favor, much of which has barrel notes; oak, tart cherry, tart grape cab sav. 10% abv. Unbelievable. Id like to have a palate of these

Bottled 9/14/12. Pours a deeper copper, some maroon hues with a small fizzy head that fades quick into a ring around the glass with a nice amount of carbonation constantly racing up the sides of the glass. Aromas very vinous, musty, some dark fruit and light breads. Taste is loaded with barrel character from the Cab Sauvignon, oak, some tart apple, light plum. Keeps a very lively mouthfeel. Flavors culminate in a crisp, dry finish. On the higher end of the tart/sour spectrum, but enough character to withstand the alcohol content (very well-hidden) and keep it drinkable. Excellent beer.

Bottle from the brewery. Poured to a Ynibroue tulip glass. This one pours dark reddish purple with a hint of brown and a one finger off white head that dissipates quickly in a fizzy furry.. Aroma is strong vinous cabernet notes, sour vinegar, black cherry and other fruits. Flavor is a beautiful medley of dark cherries and sour vinegar, some bold wine like notes, other fruits, and a bit of booze intermingled with oak on the back end. Super tart and sour with nearly spritzy high carbonation. Heavy bodied and a big beer that can probably sneak up on you. Good stuff.

Pours dark brown, almost purple with dissipating head. Nose is dark cherries and grapes, little winey. Taste follows nose with cherry, grape, currants, red wine sweetness, moderately sour, a touch of planty bitterness/dryness on the finish. Effervescent carbonation. Don't taste any of that 10%. Stellar sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

American wild ale 
10% ABV 

APPEARANCE: Gorgeous colors in this beer. Deep ruby mahogany, with a burnt orange rim variation. Little to no head with very light lacing. 

AROMA: Nice and sour fruit right away. The Cabernet barrel explodes with notes of oak, currants, black cherry jam some barnyard funk rounds it out. 

TASTE: Very tart lots of green apples which I didn't get on the nose. Fades rather quickly into the currant and cherries. Definitely getting that Cabernet flavors and nice oakiness. 

MOUTHFEEL: Oddly enough without having a head on the beer there is a lot of prickly carbonation. Medium bodied slight oily feel maybe due to the Cabernet barrels. 

OVERALL: Great, easily approachable sour. Wine drinkers will really appreciate the complex flavor profiles. Thoroughly enjoyed this, I think sharing the bottle was the way to go. The high ABV is hidden well and makes it almost to easy to drink. 

RATING: 4/5 Zombie Heads!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 First batch bottle pour at bottleworks. The perfect beer.  Strange aroma.  Sour all around. Long lasting sour finish. There is nothing I can say to describe this beer accurately. The best.

Bottle shared by Chad. Aroma is red wine vinegar, cranberry, and oak. Pours deep burgundy with a nice carbonation but not a very big head. Taste is sour cherry, wine vinaigrette, slight currant, and a big oaky finish. Tart mouthfeel and a perfect oak presence throughout. Loved this one a lot.

22 oz bottle...pretty cloudy..chill haze skunky aroma...but that is where bad ends..the flavor is rich and complex...slight barrel oak..not like a buttery chard from knights vallet but good in that respect..very copmlpx and well balanced. not too much on the carbonation but just right to bring esters...extremely floral but from all the above. great beer

Pours a hazy reddish brown color with a sizzling quickly disappearing fizz. Has the aroma of tart berries and grapes. The flaming is a Chuck Norris roundhouse kick straight to your taste buds. Very tart with notes of berry, grape, cab sauv. Very unique which makes it very nice to me.

OMG, beautiful. Sweet cab like aroma, rich luscious color..no I am not rating a wine. But smell goes on for ever. Reissuing Chardonnay characteristics with a Malbec body...again not rating a wine. But this stuff is amazing. Got from a friend in a bomber bottle fir our bachelorette party and it is sliding the party into oblivion. Great fizzy champagne like carbonation...and we only have two bottles. Let the games begin.

En flaska batch 007 (thanks STLWill). Stickande doft av frukt, kola och körsbär. Suuuur! Precis avslutat en cantillon geuze och det är läsk i jämförelse. Tror det är cuve de Tomme jag närmast tänker på eller så är det någon av flarrorna i Lost Abbey-lådan. Brutal citronsyra. 10% alkohol känner jag inte ett spår av. Fantastisk suring man gärna vill uppleva fler gånger. Delar med Egil och Isabel.

Batch 7, bootle conditioned 1 year. (Toronto) Incredibly hard to come by in Canada. Luckily my sister spent part of her honeymoon in SF. Pouring deep red, no head. Spour cherry with hints of currants and wine. Ive had this on tap at the Russian River brewpub. Honestly, its better in the bottle. It needs time to mature (sour up). Found a 001 batch bottle at the Tornado in SD. So sour and delicioso!

On tap at the Brewpub in February 2014. 

Hazy mahogany with a minimal head. Wow what a beer! Vinous with red berries, oak, vinegar and lemon. Very sour and with no hints of alcohol. I am so glad that I have at least one bottle of this one at home.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a clear light brown reddish color with a thin light tan head. Aroma is mostly acetic acid with a hint of dark fruits. Flavor is quite tart, but very drinkable. Sour lingers long into the finish. Excellent sour. One of my favs.
Batch 7, bottle pours a clear reddish brown with fast fading head. Aroma is tart fruit and oak. Taste is a big long lasting sour fruit with a sharp finish. Excellent

(Rating 800). Bottle, thanks Josh! Pours a deep reddish brown with thin white head, and champagne-like active carbonation. Nice tart aroma with elements of vanilla, dark fruit, and rich red wine. Wow, really impressive combination of flavors. Very tart, mouth-puckering finish with a warming sensation. Flavors and a sensation of a very complex red wine up front, but then the vanilla and oak come big mid-palate, and tartness kicks in at the finish. Nice complexity with every sip standing on its own and revealing new elements.

Deep reddish amber in color... Aroma of vinegar, oak, cherries.... Flavor is caramel, cherries, vinegar acidity... Really enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown with no head. Like sour cold red wine with carbonation. Not sure how to judge this. No hops but bitter (from currants?)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Too many geuzes only one toilet, Ulfborg 2012. Muddy brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of port, weak sour, raisins and acetone. A flavor of raisins, port and sweets.

Pours a deep red to brown with little white head. Aroma is of cherry, currant and slight smoke. Taste is jammy berry with some light hop residual presence and a definite chewing tobacco essence. Overall, my 2nd favorite of the big four RR sours.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Clear reddish-purple-brown, no head. Flat berry nose, probably currant, vanilla, caramel, incredibly complex nose. Sour, not overly so, some sweetness, some bitterness. Maybe some small amount of umami. Very effervescent mouthfeel, quite acidic, but again not overly so. Extremely long finish. The taste has been changing as it warms and opens up. Generally very winey-tasting beer, excellent. Very complex, exceedingly well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
375ml bottle pours deep red with zero head. Funk wine and sour cherries aroma. Taste is the same. Great beer

bottle from tleaver33. enjoyed while pondering my shitty January schedule. pours deep burgundy, easily mistakable for a nice Merlot. nose of berries, grapes, light oak, vanilla. taste has under base of sweet berries. acidic tart finish. wow.

Excellent brew little head extremely good aroma smells like the inside of a Zinfandel barrel. Slight tobacco slight sourness somewhat fruity very well-balanced very complex multi malt/funky brew very enjoyable

Batch 3x3

A: Pours a plum red with excellent clarity. No carbonation evident despite exceedingly audible pop when cork came out. Looks like a Pinot Noir honestly - beautiful.

S: Grape skins, farm, funky horse blanket. The cab bals come through here. Nicely woven with the bacteria in the juice.

T: Wow, grapes, oak, grain. French oak. straw, currants play nicely here too. Very complex beer, hard for me to articulate everything going on here.

M: Medium body with decent carbonation. Leaves palate a little dry.

O: Excellent sour. I prefer the supplication series, but this is a close second from RR. Good job again Vin.

Serving type: bottle

04-25-2011

Batch date 1/13/13 12 oz bottles shared amongst the family Xmas gathering, brought from Belmont Station by STEVE! Pours a very dark burgundy/reddish purple with an off white head and some nice effervescence. Aroma has grapes, plums, heavy wine and oak, with spices. Taste is strong, smoothly sweetly fruity with strength, solid oak-y/wine backbone. Full bodied and syrupy. This took some getting used to as it was wild, but was quite excellent.

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87. BATCH 7.
APPEARANCE: clear red beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: wood, red fruits, somewhat sour.
TASTE: wood, sour, fruity.

On tap at City Beer, SF. 2011 version aged in Pinot barrels with currants. Pours a clear copper/amber red with a small tanned head. Nose shows loads of currants as expected, Pinot, tart, brown sugar & cloves. Smells like a good red. Upfront sour currants and red wine barrels on the taste. Syrupy brown sugar like sweetness comes through. Almost like sucking on a warhead the sugary palate is felt. Fucking different shit. Booze is felt at 10% but well hidden. This stuff knocks you around. Great sour beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a brown with a slight hint of red. Tastes of dark fruits and even a hint of oak. Solid brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sort of a dirty mahogany pour with beige head that doesnt last at all. I think this beer has the noisiest head Ive every noticed. Sounds like especially violent Rice Crispies. Theres a significant red wine note to the nose with lots of wood and funk. The currants are definitely noticeable as well. Theres also some tobacco in there. Quite sour on the palate with lots of that red wine flavour coming out. Good funk levels with enough fruit to balance everything out. For me the alcohol level detracts from an otherwise excellent brew. The carbonation is also really prickly.
Tap at Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries and sourness.

Bottle. Pours a reddish brown color with no head. Nose is wonderfully sour and tart with distinctive Cabernet notes. Taste is a romantic sour tart mixture of fruit, tart citrus and deep tannins . Finishes tartly on the palate, A wonderful sour. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Pours a red brown with a tan head and tart aroma of fruits and wine. Taste is tart and sour, complex with dark fruit, grapes, red wine, wood, vinegar, currants, and oak leading to a long, dry sour finish. Great sour ale with tons of flavor
Murky red. Aroma is mild tart and winey quality. Taste is big sour, significant cab sav wine flavour. Very dry finish which is perfect. Overall, a great sour - not too sweet, good level of sourness.

On tap at Beachwood BBQ poured into a tulip. Appears reddish brown with a thin cap that is not sticking. Aroma is sour cherries (the currants?), vinegar, barrel notes of oak and grape, plus tobacco and the yeast/bacteria funk. Flavors start with puckering tart cherry, ease into light fruit sweetness, and end with those drying red wine elements. Medium-full bodied, silky texture, active carbonation, and a dry finish. Complex and interesting overall.

12 ounce bottle. Huge grape, wood and vinegar aroma. Dark ruby red appearance with steady amounts of carbonation, little foam. Flavors match the nose, very tart and sour, red wine aspects, mellow wood flavor in the background helps keep sourness approachable, aged ale aspect makes it a highly drinkable. Bubbly palate, medium bodied. The flavor just keeps coming, very durable and potent. I swirled it around for about 20 seconds and the taste kept popping out the entire time. Overall excellent and one of the best sours I've ever had. It's worth hunting down if you like this style.
Bottle @ Halling Odense.. It pours clear dark brown with a small white head. sour, fruits, grapes, oak, light dark fruits, tobacco, white wine.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 375ml bottle, thanks bytemesis! Pours dark red brown with a finger of head. Nose is tart earthy oak, dark fruits, wine, funk. Mouthfeel is smooth and well carbonated. Taste is tart berry, earthy, oak, wine, barrel, funk, sweet notes, bready notes. Finish is tart bready fruit, some caramel, plum, berry. Not boozy at all for 10%. Complex. Delicious.
